meanings.sent1: Tommy felt like a plonker when he forgot his homework at home.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike someone or something with force.
meanings.sent1: He accidentally plonkered the door with his shoulder while rushing in.
meanings.sent2: The boxer aimed to plonker his opponent with a powerful punch.

meanings.sent4: The storm plonkered the trees, leaving a trail of destruction.
meanings.sent5: The hammer plonkered the nail into the wall effortlessly.

meanings.definition: A wooden or metal peg used to secure or fasten something in place.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter inserted the plonker into the joint to hold the pieces together.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to use a plonker to keep the tent firmly anchored to the ground.
